verbs.description: motorize (third-person singular simple present motorizes, present participle motorizing, simple past and past participle motorized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fit something with a motor.
examples: Most canoe aficionados would argue that motorizing a canoe removes the pleasurable aspects of traveling in one.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To supply something or someone with motor vehicles.
examples: Once Jack decided to motorize his paper delivery route, he found he could reach far more subscribers.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To supply armoured vehicles; to mechanize.
examples: The refit plan recommended that the first battalion be motorized to upgrade their offensive capabilities.
